title: Is Tryndamere a candidate for a rework?
body:
His kit is old, stale, and has little to no counterplay. The only effective way to deal with him is to either counterpick him  ({{champion:24}} {{champion:33}} {{champion:75}}{{champion:17}} {{champion:10}}  ) or  build  {{item:3047}} {{item:3143}} {{item:3075}}.  

I wish that there was more to Tryndamere than just splitpushing, because he's a god amazing split pusher and duelist, but at the same time makes teamfights a 4v5. And you often will need more than just 1 person to duel him out due to the fact that his ultimate give him 6 seconds to do whatever the hell he wants unless he got hard cced.

Overall an unenjoyable experience to play with and play versus.

Because despite having excellent base stats, he is so damn squishy that he dies extremely fast or has to flee his tail between his legs after poping his ultimate. Also, because he is melee, any slow / hard CC will destroy him (destroy = having to use his ultimate before doing any meaningful damage).

Yes, he CAN be efficient in TF under the right circumstances. But he will have to adopt an assassin-pattern approach, aka flank the ennemy team after they used most of his CC. If he doesn't flank or if the ennemy team didn't use most of their CC, he will be extremely useless. Unless he is overfed of course.

And you often will need more than just 1 person to duel him out due to the fact that his ultimate give him 6 seconds to do whatever the hell he wants unless he got hard cced.
> 
> Overall an unenjoyable experience to play with and play versus.

So you are basically saying that the reason why the champion exists (being a 1v1 monster, but having a weak teamfight, and being thanks to his sustain and his farming capacity the best splitpusher in the game) should be removed to make him a teamfighter, and weaker in duels ?

You clearly didn't understand the champion. Or, rather, you understand the champion and talk about it as if his gameplay was a _mistake_. Now what, you think he is frustrating ? Have you ever played against Tahm Kench, Poppy just after her rework, or other "one shotting tanks" ? How can you be so frustrated against a champion without any hard CC, vulnerable to exhaust/CC, that relies so much on his ultimate ?

No, indeed, he isn't a teamfight beast. But he still can flank, and force a lot of things on himself. And above all, the moment someone picks Tryndamere, OF COURSE he is going to splitpush. Hey, what do you think ? That everyone needs to play Malphite and farm up until you can group and ulti ? A strong aspect of League of Legends in my opinion is that there are many different kind of champions, hence many kind of gameplays and playstyles. As the meta evolves, some get better during a few patches, some weaker, and so on. But some players, especially in soloqueue, feel confident mainly on a certain kind of champions, like mid lane long ranged poke champions, aggressive AP supports, utilitary tanks, afk farmer hypercarries, snowball roaming assassins ...

I, for myself, enjoy the splitpush playstyle, with champions such as Jax, Shen, Yasuo, and above all Tryndamere. Yes, I _enjoy_ splitpushing. Would you deny a player to play what he can and likes to play ? Or would you rather champions get uniformized so they all fit one single playstyle meant for teamfights, as you seem to suggest.

No, I am clearly opposed to a Tryndamere rework. Especially since I assume, reading the author, that he isn't himself a Tryndamere player, and that he can suggest such a thing feels even more unhealthy.

Thanks for reading.

He forces fights into 3v4s, not 4v5s, as you either send 2 people or he gains an objective and a kill. The only real way to make Tryndamere into a teamfighter is to turn him into a Juggernaut/More Focused Bruiser. For example, giving him more damage the more enemy champions come near him and removing critical strikes from his kit. There are many other ideas that get rid of many of his other abilities that's just simply a piece of his kit that can be changed to make it more teamight focused.

I agree with the first part of your comment, but I disagree with your suggestion. He has a really strong 1v1 thanks to his 5 seconds "window" where you can just try to get time and survive, especially devastating agaisnt squishies. Put him more damage when he is 1v3/1v4 ... more people often means more CC. More CC means you can't DPS as much, plus it makes it harder to focus only one enemy. Meaning you would give him damage that he couldn't use.

Why would you turn him into a sub-Darius when he can just be Tryndamere ?
1v3/1v4 wouldn't be how he'd played if Riot changed his kit to what I had above, as it simply wouldn't work. He would enter Teamfights and be a bigger threat the more conflict he gets in to.
I just hate that his kit is entirely one-dimensional and very, very plain and basic.
